[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Inventory Management System (IMS) document defines requirements for tracking, categorizing, and managing inventory efficiently.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: IMS facilitates inventory tracking, integrates with QuickBooks POS, and supports online sales and CRM synchronization.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: IMS integrates with QuickBooks POS and Salesforce CRM.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: IMS provides a web-based interface for internal and external users.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: IMS supports touchscreens, barcode scanners, and Zebra printers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: IMS synchronizes inventory with QuickBooks POS and Salesforce.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: IMS supports email notifications and third-party integrations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: IMS is configurable for different business workflows.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: IMS links inventory with CRM and online sales platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 MISSING-TAG2: IMS handles large inventory datasets efficiently.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: IMS tracks inventory, manages categorization, and generates reports.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: IMS is limited to inventory management and does not replace financial systems.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: IMS assumes stable integration with QuickBooks POS and Salesforce CRM.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: QuickBooks POS: Point-of-sale system for transactions and inventory.
Inventory: Collection of items managed in the system.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 MISSING-TAG1: IMS is designed for administrators, sales associates, and donors.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with QuickBooks POS for inventory updates.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall synchronize donor and transaction data with Salesforce CRM (REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive, touch-optimized interface.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall minimize data entry errors through validation (REQ-USAB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall handle up to 10,000 inventory items simultaneously.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall process inventory updates within 2 seconds (REQ-PERF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store inventory and transaction data securely.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall support real-time inventory queries (REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with web application security best practices.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to PCI DSS standards for secure payment processing.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log critical actions for auditability.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall scale dynamically based on transaction volume (REQ-ATTR-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow categorized inventory tracking.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall support automated pricing suggestions (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall enable donation receipt generation and inventory tagging (REQ-FUNC-002).

[SEC] 3. Verification: Unit, integration, and user acceptance testing validate functionality.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, training materials, and configuration templates.
[SEC] 5. References: QuickBooks POS integration guide, and Salesforce CRM API documentation.
